meanings.definition: A localized, blood-filled dilation of a blood vessel caused by disease or weakening of the vessel wall.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that an aneurysm is like a small, weak balloon filled with blood.
meanings.sent2: The aneurysm in his brain required immediate medical attention.
meanings.sent3: When the blood vessel threw a party, the aneurysm was the balloon animal artist.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was an aneurysm waiting to burst, infectious and uncontrollable.
meanings.sent5: The aneurysm pulsed ominously, like a ticking time bomb in his body.

meanings.definition: An abnormal widening or ballooning of a part of an artery due to weakness in the wall of the blood vessel.
meanings.sent1: The aneurysm in the artery resembled a bulging, fragile bubble.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon successfully repaired the aneurysm in the patient's aorta.
meanings.sent3: The aneurysm in the road caused a traffic jam of blood cells.
meanings.sent4: His anger was an aneurysm, swelling and ready to burst at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The aneurysm loomed like a dark cloud over his cardiovascular health.
